info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:55PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Yuma County through 630 PM MDT... At 555 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Highland Center, or 18 miles southwest of Holyoke, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yuma County, including the following locations... Alvin, Wauneta and Clarkville. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 257 and 270. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for northeastern Colorado...and southwestern Nebraska.
